page.title: 20Commemoration of the Project
page.content: On completing the Domesday Project we wondered how we could commemorate it. Mrs Jane Bird, propogator at Tresco Abbey Gardens, offered school a horse chestnut tree that she had grown from a conker. This was it! And so a large and carefully prepared hole was dug. The tree{Aesculus Hippocastanea} grown from a seed collected in Kew Gardens in October 1980 and grown on at Tresco Abbey Gardens by Mrs Bird, was planted between the School and School House by Mr.Kenneth Christopher, Manager of Tresco Estate and Island Councillor, during the annual visit of members of the Education Committee of the Isles of Scilly Council. We hope that in years to come the tree will give shelter and delight to all islanders and visitors alike.
